intro: Stephanopholis, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are typically lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Stephanopholis produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by distinctive seed heads that resemble small, spiky balls. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wetlands.
